Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery vessel, possibly a stemmed bowl; white slip; interior probably slipped (Register); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx or siren to left (head, large curlicue, chest and part of wing remaining; added red on hair and wing); incised rosette with red as filling ornament; at bottom left of sherd, trace of undetermined motif.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 322, no. 1453, pl. 192)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 109, no. 320.6, pl. XXXIV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2108) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 215, no. 47)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5973 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
